item.title: Pothole on the flyover the A2 black prince junction, 17th December
item.description:
Yes, again there a pothole on the flyover A2 at the black prince which requires some Attention, also when will the whole length of the flyover between the two roundabouts be correctly maintained as the is dips on the road surface, and when will the kerbs that are damaged be replaced. When it rain the roundabout at the bottom of gravel hill drains need to be inspected and made safe as when it rains the roundabout flood will surface water which causes traffic to avoid the surface water. On the whole itâ€™s not the first time l have reported and informed the council of the problems and poor road surface around the roundabout and the flyover. It would to see improved of the road and all outstanding traffic issues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped furniture and boxes of toys, 17th December
item.description:
Dumped dismantled furniture. Some bags of garden wasted and two boxes of old toys.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydenham Rise, Forest Hill, Greater London

item.title: No lightning in Erin close, 17th December
item.description:
Erin Close has no lightning at all and there were several incidents in the past years: - a vehicle was stolen - a vehicle was broken into - resident installed lights on garages were cut and damaged With both elderly and small kids living in the close proper street lighting could improve security
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erin Close, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped bulky items at the top of Telford Avenue, 17th December
item.description:
Several large items (single mattress, bed frame (?) and a large flat screen TV) have been flytipped in the last few days on top of a pile of Serco bags of leaves on the pavement on the north side near Conway House at the end of the road currently closed off due to TfL works.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telford Avenue, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken parking signpost ( Parkers Row, Bermondsey), 17th December
item.description:
A parking signpost is broken and is lying across the pavement, partially obstructing the footway. Please can this be made safe and the sign reinstated. It is located very close to the Most Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church, Bermondsey. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parker's Row, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Runbsih all over the street, 17th December
item.description:
Absolutely disgusting, rats running around and you are letting people turn uo with there rubbish to dump here. I live on this estate and this is an ongoing problem. If you have CCTV you would make a lot of money from fines. Please remove this rubbish, I don't want to see anymore rats.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
